definition: to emit/to give off/to send out (or up, forth)/to brave/to face/reckless/to falsely adopt (sb's identity etc)/to feign/(literary) to cover

home/family/(polite) my (sister, uncle etc)/classifier for families or businesses/refers to the philosophical schools of pre-Han China/noun suffix for a specialist in some activity, such as a musician or revolutionary, corresponding to English -ist, -er, -ary or -ian/CL:個|个[ge4]

sentences.english: He was also a reckless adventurer who got lucky.
sentences.chinese: 同時他也是一位輕率魯莽而運氣十足的冒險家。

sentences.english: Many explorers hoped to discover Eldorado, the fabled City of Gold.
sentences.chinese: 冒險家都夢想找到埃爾多拉多這個傳說中的黃金之城。

sentences.english: Forster was a venturer by nature.
sentences.chinese: 福爾斯特生來是一位冒險家。

sentences.english: Mr Sarkozy, though, is nothing if not a risk-taker.
sentences.chinese: 毫無疑問，薩科齊是一個十足的冒險家。

sentences.english: Especially as what made me an adventurers was not free chioce, but fate.
sentences.chinese: 特別是當命運令我身不由己的去做冒險家的時候。

sentences.english: The natives thought the explorer was possessed by a fiend.
sentences.chinese: 當地人認爲，這個冒險家被一個魔鬼虜去了。

sentences.english: He was extremely muscular, an adventurer, and he would tell these bawdy stories.
sentences.chinese: 他是肌肉猛男，一個冒險家，而且會講葷故事。

sentences.english: I made the acquaintance of the well-known adventuress.
sentences.chinese: 我認識了大名鼎鼎的女冒險家。

sentences.english: He is a really quite a risk-taker.
The most successful adventurers take the high road of risk-taking without falling off the mountain.
sentences.chinese: 最成功的冒險家佔領冒險精神的高地，不會跌落高山。

sentences.english: Many of these adventurers appear to have no training in photography at all.
sentences.chinese: 許多這樣的冒險家幾乎沒接受過什麼專業攝影指導。

sentences.english: He is a venturer by nature.

sentences.chinese: 我是個追求刺激的人，一個冒險家。

sentences.english: CrashBall is a new entertainment for adventurers.
sentences.chinese: 這遊戲是專爲愛冒險家而高設的。

sentences.english: Mr S arkozy, though, is nothing if not a risk-taker.
sentences.chinese: 薩科齊無疑是一個十足的冒險家。

sentences.english: In America, Greyhounds can be traced back to the 1500's, brought in by Spanish explorers.
sentences.chinese: 靈緹於公元1500年被西班牙冒險家帶到美國。

definition: to triumph in every battle (idiom); invincible/to succeed in every undertaking
the man (or woman) of the moment (idiom)/influential figure
lit. veteran of a hundred battles (idiom)/fig. experienced/seasoned
to have a unique style of one's own (idiom)
to win instant success (idiom)/to become an instant hit
variant of 策劃|策划[ce4 hua4]
lit. dragons and snakes mingle (idiom)/fig. a mix of good people and scumbags
